discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/amazon-vpc-limits.html
Increasing this quota increases the quota on internet gateways per Region by the same amount.
You can increase this limit so that you can have hundreds of VPCs per Region.

questions.answer_description:
The maximum number of VPCs allowed per region is 5. The limit for Internet gateways per region is directly correlated to this one. Increasing this limit will increase the limit on Internet gateways per region by the same amount.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Appendix_Limits.html
questions.question_text: What is the default maximum number of VPCs allowed per region?

questions.answer_description:
By default, Amazon EC2 metric data is automatically sent to CloudWatch in 5-minute periods.
However, you can, enable detailed monitoring on an Amazon EC2 instance, which sends data to CloudWatch in 1-minute periods
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-cloudwatch.html
questions.question_text: How often is metric data is sent to CloudWatch when detailed monitoring is enabled on an Amazon EC2 instance?
A route table in VPC can be associated with multiple subnets. However, a subnet can be associated with only ______ route table(s) at a time.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A subnet in VPC can be associated with only one route table at a time.

questions.answer_description:
Every subnet in your VPC must be associated with exactly one route table at a time. However, the same route table can be associated with multiple subnets.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Route_Tables.html

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is NOT true of CloudWatch?

choices.C: CloudWatch can be accessed using CloudWatch API.
choices.D: CloudWatch can be accessed using the CloudWatch CLI for iOS.
choices.B: CloudWatch can be accessed using the AWS console.
choices.A: CloudWatch can be accessed using the AWS SDKS.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
CloudWatch does not have a specific Command Line Interface (CLI) designed specifically for iOS. The AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) is a unified tool that allows users to interact with various AWS services, including CloudWatch, from the command line of their operating system. While the AWS CLI can be used on macOS, which is based on the iOS operating system, it is not specific to iOS devices.

questions.answer_description:
AWS Cloudwatch can be accessed from the Amazon CloudWatch Console, CloudWatch API, AWS CLI and AWS SDKs.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/accessing_cloudwatch.html

Amazon CloudWatch monitors your Amazon Web Services (AWS) resources and the applications you run on AWS in real-time.
You can use CloudWatch to collect and track metrics, which are the variables you want to measure for your resources and applications. CloudWatch alarms send notifications or automatically make changes to the resources you are monitoring based on rules that you define. For example, you can monitor the CPU usage and disk reads and writes of your Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Ama-zon EC2) instances and then use this data to determine whether you should launch additional in-stances to handle increased load. You can also use this data to stop under-used instances to save money. In addition to monitoring the built-in metrics that come with AWS, you can monitor your own custom metrics. With CloudWatch, you gain system-wide visibility into resource utilization, application performance, and operational health.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/DeveloperGuide/WhatIsCloudWatch.html

choices.D: You gain system-wide visibility into resource utilization, application performance, and operation-al health.
choices.C: You can control and monitor all Security Groups and their related rules.
choices.B: You can set CloudWatch alarms to send notifications or automatically make changes to the resources you are monitoring, based on rules that you define.
choices.A: You can use CloudWatch to collect and track metrics, which are the variables you want to measure for your resources and applications.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an incorrect statement about Amazon CloudWatch?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Amazon CloudWatch does not provide direct control over Security Groups and their rules. CloudWatch is primarily focused on monitoring and collecting metrics from various AWS resources and applications. It does not offer direct management or control capabilities for Security Groups.
I think that B is the correct answer
